item.name: Pizzettes
item.description: Not to be confused with wafer-thin waffled pizzelles, this rich brownie-like cookie packed with warm spices is exactly the opposite.

item.name: Detroit-Style Pepperoni Pizza
item.description: So you want to make pizza, but it’s your first time. This Detroit-style pizza from Bryan Ford, which uses a half-batch of his Master Dough, is perfect for beginners because you don’t have to shape the dough or wrangle a hot pizza stone. If you don’t have a Detroit pizza pan (its deep sides and black anodized aluminum help achieve a crust that’s fluffy on the inside but crisp all around), that’s okay: Use a 13x9" baking pan or two 8x8" baking pans.

item.name: Marranitos Enfiestados
item.description: Rick Martinez’s take on the popular Mexican pig-shaped cookie goes all out with a ginger-spiced dough and tons of sprinkles.

item.name: Roasted Okra
item.description: I love me some okra, but prep is usually enough to avoid making it. This simple dish requires only a single cut per pod and a dash of seasoning- that's it.

item.name: Pork Steaks
item.description: Pork is called "the other white meat", but this sous vide technique is so dang good I'm gonna graduate it up to "THE white meat".

item.name: Roasted Brussels Sprouts
item.description:
A lot of places are doing dang good brussels lately, but none can touch [Salty Sow](http://saltysow.com/). They serve them fried, topped with pecorino and golden raisins. Yes, please.
We started trying to emulate it, but it's such a versatile dish, you can make it however you want. Consider this a loose guide.

item.name: Buttery Kimchi Chicken
item.description: This spicy and sweet, slightly nutty, and creamy stew from developer Sunny Lee is worth the tending (and time) it requires over the stove.

item.name: Tequila, Beer, and Citrus Cocktail
item.description: The holiday cocktail that takes you straight to the beach (and isn’t that where you want to be anyway?).

item.name: Pasta With Mushrooms and Cashew Cream
item.description: Might you mistake this vegan cream for actual alfredo sauce? Maybe. Maybe not. It’s delicious either way.

item.name: New York Strip
item.description: Cooking a steak in a water bath is the ultimate, both in terms of flavor and laziness. Dial in a precise temperature, then go take a nap.

item.name: Green Spaghetti
item.description:
We saw this on Jamie Oliver's TV show and made it that night. He calls for **cavolo nero** as the greens, but dinosaur kale or spinach or any dark leafy green will do. The bigger the green, the easier it is to fish out of the boiling water, so keep that in mind.
Start to finish this whole recipe takes about 10 minutes, but it's pretty rapid fire once you get stated. Have plates and an appetite standing by.

item.name: One Minute Muffin
item.description: This flax muffin is quick, vertsatile (just mix in other goodies), and only makes one at a time, so you've got no huge tray to tempt you. Custom muffins every morning!

item.name: Bon Appétit's Perfect Pizza
item.description: With the amount of love, time, and research that went into making what constitutes the “perfect” pizza, you’ll definitely want to share. Welcome to the best-ever excuse to invite people over for a pizza party.

item.name: Green Chile Stew
item.description: This is a simple one, consisting of a pre-made soup mix and whatever you've got around the kitchen (or campsite). Feel free to sub/swap/switch anything in the ingredient list— anything's fair game!

item.name: Marinated Tofu With Brussels Sprouts and Farro
item.description: The soul of this recipe comes from the ginger and tamari marinade that gives a sweet and savory winter coat to the crispy tofu.
